noun.description: A tetraploid organism in which the four sets of chromosomes are produced by the duplication of the chromosomes of a single diploid species.

adjective.description: Of an organism or population: characterized by autotetraploidy.

origin: 1930s; earliest use found in John Burdon Sanderson Haldane (1892–1964), geneticist. From auto- + tetraploid.
